intro: Pedicularis chamissonis subsp. japonica, commonly known as the Japanese lousewort, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. This species is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a distinctive yellow throat. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its morphology includes erect stems with opposite, ovate leaves and is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates.
